intro: Leptonychia banahaensis var. banahaensis, commonly known as the Banahae rock fern, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of China. It is a member of the Polypodiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit. The plant features intricate, leathery fronds with a distinctive, finely divided structure. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, typically found on rocky substrates in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
